## Research

### INED \| 2021 - present

#### Research assistant for project Sogenre \| September 2022 - August 2024

Studying **early socialisation and parental practices**, centered around bodycare. I'm in charge of the quantitative part of the project, making use of Elfe data: data cleaning, analysis design and implementation. Also taking part in literature reviews, writing and dissemination of results.

**Work in progress:**

-   *"Parental care during the first year of life: gender and social variations in practices and tastes",* Y. Demoli, C. Hamelin, O. Samuel, A. Sheridan

-   *"Habiller pour genrer ? Pratiques sociales autour du vêtement dans la toute petite enfance",* C. Brugeilles, A. Paillet, O. Samuel, A. Sheridan

#### Data manager/statistician for project DICE \| April 2021 - July 2022

Development of Inequalities in Child Educational Achievement: **Cross-country research project** which aimed to compare the **factors that influence socio-economic development gaps of children aged 0 to 16 years old in six countries**: France, England, Germany, Italy, the United States and Japan, using large nationally representative datasets. Participation in the literature review, data harmonisation, longitudinal analyses design and implementation, writing papers and project management. Using Elfe and DEPP data.

**Main collaborators:** A. Solaz, L. Panico, T. Schneider, E. Washbrook, J. Waldfogel, R. Keizer.

**Work in progress:**

-   *"Family trajectories, maternal education and achievement gaps: a comparative perspective. Findings on England, France, Germany and the US",* J. Dräger, S. Kwon, V. Perinetti Casonir, T. Schneider, A. Sheridan, A. Solaz, J. Waldfogel, E. Washbrook

-   *"The relevance of tracking and social segregation for growing achievement gaps by parental education in lower secondary school. A longitudinal analysis in France, Germany, the United States, and England",* J. Dräger, S. Kwon, M. Olczyk, V. Perinetti Casonir, T. Schneider, A. Sheridan, A. Solaz, J. Waldfogel, E. Washbrook, under review

#### Research internship \| April 2020 - November 2020, followed by a contract with the OECD \| January 2021 - March 2021

Studying the socio-economic variations in the relationship between **parenting styles and PISA 2018 scores, across OECD countries**. Data treatment, literature review, contributing to analyses and writing of the paper.

**Work in progress:**

-   *"Is parental emotional support linked to better PISA test scores and subjective well-being of children ? An international look at socio-economic gaps in parental support and their outcomes",* L. Berger, L. Panico, A. Sheridan, O. Thévenon
